pullRequest.body:
Composition with a LinearIsometryEquiv on a finite dimensional real Hilbert space preserves integrals.

---

nodes.body: Can you try generalizing this to `LinearIsometryEquivClass`?

I would love to but that requires restructuring the whole `LinearIsometry` file so that all the theorems are phrased for the classes and not the structure. Right now the class exists, but is basically useless. This PR was basically the reason for this experiment https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/Bundled.20sets.2Ffunctions.20with.20even.20more.20classes and I would prefer that we have a discussion on whether classes or structures are the way to go forward before starting to rewrite existing parts of mathlib.

bors d+
Let's get this in, and revisit later if one can use classes of maps instead.

I'd rather avoid importing the Bochner integral in files which are purely on measures, as this brings in a lot of material on analysis (real powers and so on). Could you move the two lemmas that involve integrals to another file, for instance `Measure.Haar.NormedSpace`?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(MeasureTheory): integral_comp for LinearIsometryEquiv

source.title: feat: Integration by parts for higher dimensional spaces
